title.narrative: 001 EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION

description.narrative: 'By 2020, capacity of the education system strengthened for delivery of quality early childhood education services in rural, pastoralist and displaced communities, which contributes to Early Childhood Development, Early Learning, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid), Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, equitable access created and quality education and training provided to all learners at pre-primary and primary level and girls' access to secondary education increased, with a focus on the most disadvantaged and vulnerable children, populations and localities

participating-org.narrative: B GUMUZ REGIONAL EDUCATION BUREAU REB

mailing-address.narrative: UNICEF House (Kazanchis - Opposite UNECA/German House) P.O. Box 1169 Addis Ababa

Provision of parental education for school readiness (including in temporary learning spaces)
System strengthening - early learning / pre-primary standards and governance

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 'By 2020, capacity of the education system strengthened for delivery of quality early childhood education services in rural,pastoralist and displaced communities

description.narrative: UNICEF advocated and provided technical support for the MoE (Ministry of Education) in revising the national Early Childhood Development and Education (ECDE) Policy Framework to guide expansion of services for young children; co-facilitated a national Early Childhood Education (ECE) diagnosis to lay the foundation for developing the ECE strategic operational plans for expanding ECE with quality and supported the development of the O-class Standards and curriculum for quality improvement. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:24/08/2020

title.narrative: Availability of appropriate national policy, leadership and budget for early learning (score)(60963)

actual.value: 2020:Score 2.5there is no separate budget line for pre-primary education, let alone adequate budget/funding, and there is no ECE policy, not to mention implementation of ECE policy. In addition, the ECE leadership is still fragmented in the MoE with inadequat

title.narrative: Share of pre-primary education in the national education budget(60964)

actual.value: 2020:Data not availableWas expected to reach five per cent, however the data on actual budget allocation were not available at the MoE. The MoE counterparts are trying to tease out the percentage of ECE budget

title.narrative: Number of children benefiting from early childhood education through alternative approaches (such as home based provision of ECD, accelerated school readiness models, parent education, among others) with support from UNICEF(61482)
Early learning policy and early learning programme including quality early learning curriculum and standards (60962)
